core_components: Standard Template Library (STL) Containers and Algorithms

practice_cycles.focus_summary: Manual Resource Management and Core Syntax
practice_cycles.short_explanation: I'm starting by getting my hands dirty with manual memory and pointers. I need to understand how the machine actually handles data before I let the STL do it for me.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Implementing classic data structures (linked lists, binary trees) from scratch using raw pointers.
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Tracing memory allocation on paper and verifying with a debugger.

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Writing basic loops and conditional logic in C syntax.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Managing pointer ownership and preventing memory leaks without smart pointers.

objective: Passes 100% of memory leak checks in Valgrind for custom structures.
Completes 15 medium-difficulty syntax exercises per week.
subjective: Visualizing the stack vs heap clearly when writing declarations.

practice_cycles.focus_summary: Transition to Modern C++ and the STL
practice_cycles.short_explanation: Now that I know how the engine works, I'll move to the modern way of writing C++. I'm replacing my raw pointers with smart pointers and using standard containers.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Refactoring previous raw-pointer projects to use unique_ptr, shared_ptr, and STL vectors/maps.
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Solving algorithmic problems using only STL algorithms (std::sort, std::find_if) instead of manual loops.

difficulty_profile.challenging: Implementing custom predicates for STL algorithms and understanding iterator invalidation.

objective: Project code contains zero 'new' or 'delete' keywords.
Successful implementation of a project across multiple files using CMake.
subjective: Appreciating the safety of the STL compared to manual management.
Finding the right container for a task based on complexity rather than habit.

objective: Code compilation rate without major linker errors on first attempt.
Successful usage of move semantics in a custom class.
Reduction in time spent debugging memory-related crashes.
subjective: Confidence in reading and interpreting template error messages.
Ability to explain the difference between 'const int*' and 'int* const' to a peer.
Feeling that the 30-hour weekly load is productive rather than overwhelming.

architect_notes: 30 hours a week is a full-time job. I've scheduled the heavy memory logic early while motivation is peak.
I'm prioritizing depth over breadth; mastering memory and the STL is the 'intermediate' threshold in C++.
The switch from raw pointers to smart pointers is the critical pivot point in this strategy.

details.reason: User initiated a new learning session.

timeline.title: Initial Practice Strategy Created
timeline.summary: Initial practice strategy created for ['Learn C++ Programming'].

details.reason: Sufficient information provided to create initial practice system.

constraints.dropout_risk: Burnout due to high weekly hourly commitment and steep syntax curve
